item.title: Search Multiple Directories with cd
item.description: If you use the command line and frequent a particular directory you can set cd to scan, not just current, but other directories as well. Modify ~/.bash_profile by appending directories to the CDPATH environment variable. # define base directory for cd command export CDPATH=$CDPATH:$HOME/Repos Restart your terminal session and now you can cd projectDir. cd will reference any subdirectories in the current directoryâ€”as well as $HOME/Repos. Autotabbing Custom Base Directories You can install an additonal library; bash-completion to use the [tab] key to autocomplete from the cd command.
